tests.name: HEMOGLOBIN
tests.meaning: Hemoglobin carries oxygen in your blood. Low levels can cause fatigue and anemia.
tests.tips: Eat iron-rich foods like spinach, beetroot, and jaggery. Combine with Vitamin C foods like citrus fruits.

tests.name: Total RBC Count
tests.meaning: Red blood cells carry oxygen throughout your body.
tests.tips: Maintain adequate iron, B12, and folate intake through green vegetables and lean meats.

tests.name: H.CT
tests.meaning: Hematocrit shows the percentage of blood made up of red blood cells.
tests.tips: Stay hydrated and maintain a balanced diet rich in iron.

tests.name: M.C.V
tests.meaning: MCV indicates the average size of your red blood cells.
tests.tips: Ensure adequate B12 and folate intake through fortified cereals and leafy greens.

tests.name: M.C.H.
tests.meaning: This test measures m.c.h. levels in your body.
tests.tips: Consult with your healthcare provider for specific recommendations based on your results.

tests.name: M.C.H.C.
tests.meaning: This test measures m.c.h.c. levels in your body.
tests.tips: Consult with your healthcare provider for specific recommendations based on your results.

tests.name: R.D.W
tests.meaning: This test measures r.d.w levels in your body.
tests.tips: Consult with your healthcare provider for specific recommendations based on your results.

tests.name: Total WBC Count (TLC)
tests.meaning: White blood cells help fight infections and diseases.
tests.tips: Maintain good hygiene, eat immune-boosting foods, and get adequate rest.

tests.name: Platelet Count
tests.meaning: Platelets help your blood clot and prevent bleeding.
tests.tips: Eat foods rich in folate and B12. Avoid excessive alcohol consumption.

tests.name: 1 Hour ESR
tests.meaning: ESR indicates inflammation in your body. Higher values may suggest infection or inflammation.
tests.tips: If elevated, follow up with your doctor. Maintain anti-inflammatory diet with turmeric and omega-3.

tests.name: Polymorphs
